author: sfgate.com
title: Movies opening Friday, Oct. 23
text:
The Assassin: A seventh century tale that takes place in China about an assassin hired to kill a political leader.
Experimenter: Most Psych 101 students in the ’70s watched the film about Yale Professor Stanley Milgram ’s experiment about obedience. Now it’s a fictional movie starring Peter Sarsgaard as Milgram.
Extraordinary Tales: Imagine Edgar Allan Poe’s stories brought to life in animation. This anthology piece features the voices of Christopher Lee , Bela Lugosi , Julian Sands , Roger Corman and Guillermo del Toro .
Jem and the Holograms: This live-action version is based on the animated TV series about a small-town girl making it big. What may interest adults is that among the cast are Molly Ringwald and Juliette Lewis (please be a baddie).
The Last Witch Hunter: Vin Diesel is the last witch hunter. Directed by Breck Eisner . Also stars Elijah Wood and Michael Caine .
Paranormal Activity: The Ghost Dimension: There’s an evil spirit (Why am I not surprised?) and a family must save their daughter from it.
Rock the Kasbah: Bill Murray plays a music manager who has hit hard times but finds a talent and enters her in what some might call the Afghan version of “American Idol.”
Room: See what happens when a 5-year-old is let out of the room he’s been in his whole life. Brie Larson plays his mother. 
Truth: Robert Redford plays Dan Rather and Cate Blanchett is producer Mary Mapes in this film dealing with a controversial report about George W. Bush ’s military service.
— Leba Hertz
